intro: Sapium leonardii-crispi, commonly known as the crinkled soapberry, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, crinkled leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by orange, fleshy fruits that contain toxic seeds. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and showy blooms. However, it should be handled with care due to the presence of toxic compounds in its parts.
